reviewDescription: I went pretty deep into credit debt because of life events. Having to get a traditional loan from a bank scared me just because of how likely it was I would be denied, and I needed someone to give me a chance to prove I could actually be responsible with money. Upstart has been one of the biggest reasons I've been able to whittle down what I owe, and I'll probably use them again in the future when I need to make a big purchase rather than dumping my money down the toilet with a credit card.

Upstart cut though all the red tape and made the process of applying for a loan extremely user friendly without lengthy paperwork. I received a very fair rate and offer in minutes. I highly recommend Upstart!!

I recently found myself in a bind needing immediate funds for car repairs, and Upstart.com came through for me in an incredible way. The entire process from application to receiving the loan was astonishingly straightforward and rapid, taking less than an hour to complete. What stood out to me was the absence of any need to contact customer service; the efficiency and clarity of their process made it completely unnecessary.

I was thoroughly impressed with the loan offers presented to me. The approval process was not only fast but also streamlined, making it evident that Upstart values its customers' time and needs. Navigating their website was a breeze. It's designed with the user in mind, offering clear directions and a user-friendly interface that made the entire process hassle-free.

I'm genuinely satisfied with my experience and the swift assistance Upstart provided during a stressful time. Their service exceeded my expectations, making the ordeal of securing a loan for emergency car repairs less daunting. The ease and seamlessness of the process have left a lasting positive impression on me, and I wouldn't hesitate to use their services again.

To anyone in need of a small loan quickly, without the hassle of complicated procedures and long waiting times, I wholeheartedly recommend Upstart. Their commitment to providing a straightforward, efficient, and user-friendly experience is evident, and it's clear they prioritize the needs and satisfaction of their customers. Thank you, Upstart, for being a reliable resource in times of need!
reviewTitle: A Lifesaver for Quick Financial Assistance - Highly Recommend Upstart!

I was sent a letter with a pre-approval code, so I went and applied. Their "automated" background check system could not even verify the fact I went to college so they made me upload my transcript (even though I have been employed for 13 years). Once I did that, they denied me. No actual decent reason was given on the letter they sent me and suggested I should re-apply. An absolute waste of time.

This company has some nerve posting their good reviews, but if you look at them they are very basic reviews with zero details on the loan, just that it was "a great experience" - one even said it took them 5 minutes to get a loan.... these are blatant lies the company paid some random to write.

In hindsight, I feel BLESSED that they denied me because many people have had horrible experiences and this company feels like a loan shark vs. a loan with shady practices luring in desperate people. Especially in the current economical times. I admit I did not do any research on them until after these problems and first red flag was them asking me to prove that I graduated college, since they could not verify that on their own. It is basic information to verify.

Lastly Upstart doesn't even provide the loan, they partner with Alliant Credit Union which has horrible reviews as well.

This was fast and easy. I am disabled so it is usually a bit difficult to get any loan because of the yearly income amount. Upstart was great. Now I can cut down my outgoing monthly amount, cut a lot of interest on those amounts and have just one easy payment. Thank you Upstart!
Quick, simple

Outstanding odds on Kredit Karma. Uploaded document's to Upstart yada yada.

reviewDescription: The loan process was swift and simple, however my loan rate jumped from an initially promised 19.5% to just under the federally legal maximum of $25% that I had to sign for, to receive a loan. In desperation I did. Having made over two years of the high interest loan payments made on time every month, I requested my rate to reduced to the original $19.5%, however my request has been repeatedly refused as “unable to be done”, when factually it can be done because an independent financial team explained the process and has offered to do so on my behalf. I would have much preferred to resolve this issue with Upstart directly, but will have to handle the matter with a third party Organization instead.
reviewTitle: Will not renegotiate a gouging interest rate.

reviewDescription: Date of experience: January 08, 2024

This is my 3rd time using Upstart to process a loan. I really appreciate Upstart and all that it has done for me. The first time I needed the loan was due to financial difficulties at home when my life partner at the time lost his job and I accumulated debt from paying bills beyond my income capacity. Paid off that one, and got a second loan which helped me further. I have had income this whole time as a teacher, but life circumstances out of my control (such as the unexpected death of my partner) made finances difficult. I'm doing so much better now - and this third loan is like a boost to my confidence to keep going. I appreciate Upstart for trusting my past records of paying off their loans entirely and on time to provide me with another one where many other lenders immediately wrote me off. There may be others struggling not entirely due to their fault, and Upstart could be a life and household saver (which is valuable beyond words and experience). So thank you Upstart for being such a reliable and secure choice for someone like myself. I whole-heartedly recommend Upstart. Last but not least is another note - I am hard of hearing, and needed someone to help me with communications the first time I applied in 2016, and the personnel I spoke to was understanding and more than courteous. Applying a second and third time didn't require further calls, but their great customer services (also accessible through email communication) has always stuck with me. So yes, 100 stars for Upstart!

reviewDescription: Very quick, very helpful.
After completing the application, everything else was great!

I recently had the pleasure of working with Upstart, and I must say that my experience was exceptional. From the streamlined application process to the competitive interest rates, Upstart truly stands out in the lending industry.

The online platform is user-friendly, making it easy to navigate and complete the application with minimal hassle. What impressed me the most was the quick approval time – I received a decision within a short period, which was a pleasant surprise compared to other lending institutions.

Upstart's innovative approach, utilizing artificial intelligence and machine learning in the underwriting process, sets them apart from traditional lenders. This not only provides a fair assessment of creditworthiness but also allows for more personalized loan terms.

The customer service was outstanding. I had a few questions during the application process, and the support team was responsive and knowledgeable. They guided me through each step and ensured a smooth experience.

Overall, I highly recommend Upstart to anyone in need of a loan. Their modern approach, efficient processes, and excellent customer service make them a top choice in the lending market. I'm grateful for the positive experience and would not hesitate to use their services again in the future.
reviewTitle: Exceptional Experience with Upstart: Innovative, Efficient, and Customer-Focused

reviewDescription: I have an Upstart loan that I’ve been consistently paying for two years. Never been late or has any payment returned. I’ve even paid double some months. This month I had an issue with the bank and my payment got returned, even though I had money in my account. Upstart charged me a $15 fee. When I reached out twice via email for assistance to have the fee waived as a courtesy, they told me no. Then they tried telling me my account was past due because of the fee. That’s a complete lie and scam. I paid my monthly payment but because they’re charging me a fee, which is not included in the monthly payment, they’re saying it’s past due. If the monthly payment got paid, and you’re charging me a fee, how is it past due when the fee isn’t part of it!? They charge insane amount of interest too. They’re glorified money hungry loan sharks. If you’re desperate and need to use them, then do so at your own risk. They will not work with you if you need help, even if you faithfully paid back 90% of your loan without issues.

reviewDescription: Date of experience: October 11, 2023

For someone who has used their personal credit to both finance a spouse's major medical procedure(s) that weren't covered by insurance, ongoing medical expenses, AND completely fund the start-up of our small business without the help of other small business loans or grants, my credit has, without question, seen better days. With high-credit utilization, my credit score can sway by a variable of 70 points overnight, and most lending companies don't really care that you've had a single late payment due to a technical glitch on the bank's end that automatically removed auto-draft payments to the card. The lender doesn't care that you've paid over $13k in medical bills out-of-pocket annually for as long as I can remember as being a reason for high utilization. But Upstart...they look beyond your credit score. I was just approved for my second loan and funds will be deposited tomorrow. This loan will be to pay off the first loan, pay off my credit cards, and have a single payment every month instead of a bunch of different payments scattered throughout the month, creating issues with other bills being due on fixed dates that don't always coincide with our payroll paydates. Thank goodness to Upstart for giving people with stories like mine a chance!
reviewTitle: All I can say is...Thank you for looking beyond my credit score...AGAIN!

Disingenuous. Bait and switch. Received a mail offer claiming that I was specifically eligible for a loan at 5.2% APR. I completed the follow up rate check will all my personal information the same day and was subsequently offered 22.9% APR. Now they won’t stop soliciting me either. Their use of high priced origination fees are laughable too. Several competitors do not charge origination fees. Check SoFi, American Express, PNC, etc. The total cost of a loan with Upstart looks a lot more like a loan from predatory payday lenders vs. reputable and consumer friendly alternatives. This company is one to avoid. I do not recommend!!
reviewTitle: Bait & Switch APR offer. Stay away

reviewDescription: Quick and easy! I feel safe using upstart and it helps me catch up on make payments faster.

Pros & Cons

Pros:

1. Quick online process
2. Initial soft pull with no credit impact
3. Provides list of lenders with fair approval and provides rates and potential loan terms from their approved lenders
4. If approved, quick funding, sometimes only 1 business day
5. Online communication is consistent
6. No penalty for paying off loan earlier than the set range

Cons:

1. You will need personal documents prior to completion such as employment docs, income verification docs, voided check, college transcripts so once you’ve been denied, know that these personal docs are sitting in a database with some financial institution that you will never do business with.
2. Partner lenders will take over and apply their own requirements on top of the Ipstart process so while you were initially provided with a rate and payment terms, your application can still be denied.
3. Denied applicants get a short and sweet email of about two lines and that's it.

If you have the following, you will be denied a loan from FinWise bank:
- Bad Credit
- High revolving lines of credit
- High debt to income ratio
- Too many hard inquiries
- Too many new lines of credit opened
- Rent instead of own (no collateral)

While the online process through Upstart is streamlined-user interface of their site is clean and simple to follow-with ongoing communication and instructions with requests for documents clear and concise, the star rating is low given that their initial soft pull communication gives those who may have the same situation as above, false hope regarding eligibility.

Second, for those who have been denied, they have just submit major documents that are floating around with an organization and are keepers of those said documents that include work information and other confidential information (like a voided check). It's like a click and bait approach, so if you don't have the following situation as painted above, Upstart is a great place to start looking for a personal loan.

For others that may be struggling with their finances/credit history/financial impacts of COVID, don't waste your time or trust with this outfit.

reviewDescription: This was amazing, fast and effective.

I am a shareholder in UPST. Since their stock has declined, I decided to apply for a loan through their website. However, first I looked at their advertisements which offer interest rates from "Fixed rates and terms Choose between personal loans in 3 or 5 year terms, with fixed rates of 5.2% - 35.99% APR."

Next I filled out an application stating a high salary with all required information. Meanwhile, my credit score is over 800 on all (3) credit services. Within minutes, I was offered $9,500 at 35%. After checking with the California and Florida Statutes regarding financing companies, the top lending rate for FLorida is 18%. "The California Constitution prohibits loans that are made primarily for personal, family or household purposes from having interest rates above 10% per year. This is California's general usury law." So, it appears that this company is violating usury laws in at least these two States. There are probably many more States that cap-out under 20%.

Therefore, I believe this company is preying on the public by misrepresenting their rates in advertisements, and are not offering legal rates that comply with the law. I believe they should be investigated and forced to comply with the usury laws in all 50 States. Shareholders, like myself, had no idea that they were offering 35% interest rates for people who have little debt, are over 65 yrs. of age (like myself), and have high credit scores over 750.
This is my 3rd loan with Upstart. Their interest rate is the cheapest I have found and they make getting a loan very quick and easy.

All over their website and their promissory note, they state that payment will be applied the date the payment is received. I sent them a payoff request letter, and overnighted them a check for the payoff amount. They received the check at 11:00 a.m. the next morning

They decided that they received the check the day after that, made up some rule about how payments only apply on the day a payment is due, and charged me interest. They are refusing to acknowledge their website and their promissory note regarding when payments are applied. It's a clear violation of the DTPA.

They are now changing their story to state they received the check on September 1, 2023 despite signing for it on August 31, 2023.

reviewDescription: Date of experience: August 30, 2023

The application process is easy, straightforward. Rates are convenient, and they work with you to give you the best option. Have done business with them more than once and I am happy with the results.

They advertise and are reviewed to give loans to people who have lower credit scores however even though my score is well above the threshold they claim and my income is more than enough to cover the payment with a small percentage they declined my initial inquiry and did not provide enough information as to why except credit wasn't good enough (it's 670 and I've made all my monthly payments for over two years which fits their advertised requirements) and because they declined it I can't do a full application where they actually would have all my info.
Very falsely advertised as being good for lower scored riskier lenders.

Was “pre-approved” several times, Company claims they “look beyond credit scores” and shows testimonials from customers with high credit card usages credit score increasing 50+ points when taking a loan, but then deny application for those TWO VERY reasons! With income at 220k a year, and 100% on time payment history for 4 years on 2 car loans and all credit scores, Get denied because credit report doesn’t have mortgage account on it!(when I’ve bought and paid off 2 houses in 2006 and 2011 and both have been removed from credit report due to age of accounts. Also get denied because credit card usage is too high(900.00 on 1500.00 ) when that’s the whole reason for taking a loan with this company! False advertisement and false reviews all the way around. Then try to pass the buck by claiming “our affiliates” didn’t approve you. Um since when did i give my permission for my information to be given to another company? I didn’t! They are right upstart doesn’t run a hard pull on your credit, but their “affiliates” do! So you get your info sold to a 3rd party within minutes of signing up, a hard credit pull, and denial all on 1! No thanks!!
reviewTitle: affiliates do hard credit check beware

Deceptive practices, ridiculous loan offer, will not delete your data when asked, horrible customer service.

Stay away from Upstart — I wish I had come to Trustpilot first before applying. The five star reviews have to be fake, I cannot see how anyone could have a positive experience with this company.

In short, this company offered a $2500.00 loan at over 30% interest — it's a worse rate than a credit card. When I asked for my application and online account to be deleted, they told me it was impossible — even though I never accepted the loan. Upstart cannot tell you why this is the case, only that their reasons are "proprietary information" that cannot be disclosed. So be prepared to have all your financial information held by Upstart forever.

Want to talk with a human? Be ready for long wait times and a complete run around. Just to find a phone number to call is a major hassle. Then everyone is working from a script and repeats the same information, even though it doesn't have any relevance to the question.

When asked how long they need to hold onto your information before it can be deleted, they respond that they have already answered (they haven't) and will not reply any further.

Terrible company and experience.

After considering various debt consolidation options, I chose Upstart as I've used them before and the funds are generated within 24 hours upon approval. the application process is fairly easy and standard procedure (bank info, salary, savings, etc.).
I would give them 4.5 out of 5 as my one issue with using a smaller bank is that they don't have the facility to accept wire payments through your banking institution. I found this out the hard way as I was charged a late payment fee a few times previously. I have bill payer through my bank and had it set on one of my paydays at the end of the month. My bank had to send an actual physical check to them which sometimes took 10-14 days to receive and process. During COVID, the mail was slow to be delivered and sometimes mail was lost. When I investigated the late fee and the lost check, I was able to waive the late fee but they insisted that I set up auto payment through them. I prefer having my bills paid through my bank because I know when they are withdrawn (I can see it in my account). Withdrawals from outside sources don't show up on my bank account until 2-3 days later. At any rate, I set up auto payment through Upstart this time. Hopefully, everything will work out okay this time around.

Hurricane Ian blasted Fort Myers Florida in 2022. Our home was damaged, FEMA, did us dirty. They did us dirty BIG TIME with Irma in 2017, didn't help us AT ALL in 2017. With this last Hurricane FEMA gave us just enough to tease us but not enough to replace our roof. Blue tarps don't last forever, and we were running out of options. I got the email for Upstart and thought, nope they will decline us. I was wrong! Look the interest rate is like 35% however I don't really need 5 years to pay off. They gave us what we need NOW. It is 14 June rainy season is about to pick up, and a leaky roof can't wait for my bonus money to hit in a few months. If you are in a bind, give it a go! What's the worst that can happen? They tell you no? They might just tell you yes like they did for us just now!
reviewTitle: Still needed help after Hurricane Ian 8months later

reviewDescription:
I have an auto loan with Rising Bank and until recently I had been mostly content with the bank. While the lack of personal touches is somewhat disconcerting, I accept it as that is how most places are after COVID. 

Recently I made a payment on my account and unbeknownst to me I made it 1 day too early. The payment was applied to the previous month (April 2023). I was woefully unaware that I could not make a payment that early without it being applied to the principal. I had intended the payment made on April 28th to go for the June payment. I have never I repeat NEVER been late on my payments and now because I made my payment 1 day too early, I am at risk of having a payment marked late. 

When I logged in to check my payment status to make sure it went through, I noticed the app said I had a balance for June. I thought this was not right. So, I called in and was told no worries we will issue a refund and you can pay us back. I then got an email that said, no the refund was denied. So, I called once again, and the service agent said no worries we will submit for them to reapply the payment. I looked on the app again today to see if the payment had reapplied and I saw it was not. I called once again, and the initial operator was bluntly honest and said there is nothing to be done and I was basically out of luck. I asked for a supervisor and was passed on to a supervisor. She reiterated what the previous person had and said she would open an investigation. 

As I stated to the supervisor, I do not understand what is so difficult about changing my payment date, or re-applying the payment to this month when it was intended for May 2023. I asked for a supervisor's email. She was reluctant to give me anyone's contact information and gave me the generic customer service email. I fail to see when a customer asks for a supervisor's email why a representative would not want to give out that information. I want to have this issue resolved immediately, as I am running out of time to make my payment in the allotted time, so it does not mark my credit. She said she would submit for a supervisor to call me back, but it would take up to 48 hours, so most likely it would not be till Monday. That would put me at 06/05/2023. I have until 06/12/2023 before my payment is marked late. 

I have gone through 3 service agents and 1 supervisor and each time no one has had the ability to help me resolve this. That is disappointing and frustrating. Who can I talk to or email directly to get this resolved?

Extremely disappointed customer,
Daniel Gutierrez
reviewTitle: I have an auto loan with Rising Bank…

All my adult life I had excellent credit. It always made life so much easier. Then, I got really sick 5 or 6 years ago. I was out of work for over a year. While I did have long term disability, being the main income in a household of 7, eventually I was crushed with medical bills and just could not keep up. The worst part of all of it was going from being able to get any type of loan I needed to having to jump through hoops only to ultimately be denied the loan. I couldn't even help my kids who were now starting their own families. As a parent, that can be a debilitating experience. One night, in desperation, I went through the process with Upstart. Not only was this the simplest loan process I ever had experienced, but I received the funds in about 48 hours. Now, the rate is higher than when I had great credit but prior to this I had been denied multiple times and took the credit hit any way! Upstart really did much more than loan me $10K. They gave me hope when I had almost given up. Again, the rates are higher but that is because on paper I was a high risk or even worse. However, they gave me an avenue to start rebuilding my life and credit. I am not sure what the rates will be when my credit is back to the levels it was prior to my illness but even if they are a few points higher, I will use them so they can take less of a risk with me and help someone else who might be denied at another bank due to circumstances beyond their control like I was. Thank you Upstart, for much more than just loaning me money.
reviewTitle: Almost had given up, then I found Upstart.

I was ridiculously stressed about an amount of around $17k of credit card debt that had been hanging around since my wedding last year. That expense along with various unforeseen auto repair expenses since racked up a considerable amount more than I'd expected leaving me stuck in a very stressful situation of a suddenly facing a huge debt in credit card payments and a record low credit score of 606 (a score I hadn't seen since I was a teenager). Even SO, Upstart completely disregarded the 606 pt score, took a fair look at my GMI ($70,720), acknowledged that I've had zero delinquent payments on all my credit cards, and approved my loan literally same day! Even more amazing, the funds arrived in my bank account immediately the next day and I was able to finally take back control of my finances! I never would have guessed there was something as amazing as Upstart available to unfortunate folks such as myself, but hallelujah- there it is! 5-stars all around, definitely recommending Upstart to my friends and loved ones.
